sentences.en: A loose rock tumbled over the precipice.
sentences.cn: 一块松动的岩石从悬崖上滚落下来。

sentences.en: A slight carelessness on this precipice could cost a man his life.
sentences.cn: 在这悬崖上稍一疏忽,就会使人丧生.

sentences.en: Both the upper and lower sandstone units of the precipice are oil - bearing.
sentences.cn: 普雷西皮斯的上部和下部砂岩单元都含油.

sentences.en: Britain was speeding towards an economic precipice.
sentences.cn: 英国正快速走向一场经济灾难.

sentences.en: He nearly fell off the precipice.
sentences.cn: 他差一点从悬崖上掉下去.

sentences.en: I stood on the edge of a precipice.
sentences.cn: 我的处境是汲汲可危的.

sentences.en: I was beginning to admit to myself that our marriage was rolling toward the edge of a precipice.
sentences.cn: 我内心开始承认我们的婚姻正走向危险的边缘。

sentences.en: In the morning sunshine a precipice shone forth beyond the gulf.
sentences.cn: 晨曦中,一座悬崖在深渊的对岸闪耀着光辉.

sentences.en: She threw herself from the precipice.
The climber fell down a precipice.
The criminals should stop on the precipice, retract from the wrong path and not go any further.
sentences.cn: 犯罪分子应当迷途知返,悬崖勒马, 不要在错误的道路上继续走下去.

sentences.en: The King now stands on the brink of a political precipice.
sentences.cn: 国王现在处于政治上岌岌可危的境地。

sentences.en: The path verges on the edge of a precipice.
sentences.cn: 这条小径濒临断崖的边缘.

sentences.en: They were perilously close to the edge of the precipice.
sentences.cn: 他们离悬崖边很近,十分危险.

sentences.en: Watching him climb up the precipice, everybody was breathless with anxiety.
sentences.cn: 看着他往悬崖上爬, 大家都捏一把汗.

trans.tran_en: a very steep side of a high rock, mountain, or cliff
